intro: Monadenium ritchiei subsp. nyambense, commonly known as the Nyambense milkbush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a milky sap, which is a key feature of the genus Monadenium. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The subspecies is noted for its resilience to drought and its potential use in traditional medicine.
